titles: The distracted young-mans answer to the injured maiden. Shewing the cruelty of his parents, in forcing him to marry another, because she had a bettet [sic] fortune, which proved the ruine of the young man and his former mistress. Te [sic] the same tune: or, the Languishing swain.
publisher: Printed for P. Pelcomb, in Fleet-street.,
notes: Verse: "It's true, thou justly maist complain ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
